Acceptance Criteria - ≥ 70% more than two broken faces on aggregates between 37.5mm and 4.75mm

Acceptance Criteria - Check if average of existing (from TPs) and any overlay will meet the ideal FBS / BE grading.
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Report using IANZ Reports for AP40 and TP PSDs
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Designer to advise if "average" blend is acceptable.
Detail of Activity / Test - Indirect Tensile Strength, ITS
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 Optimisation test per aggregate type
– BSM Dry ITS: 175 kPa to 400 kPa
– BSM Soaked ITS: 150 kPa to 350 kPa
– BSM Dry ITS: 210 kPa to 480 kPa
– BSM Soaked ITS: 180 kPa to 450 kPa
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ Report
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Designer to advise on binder content(s)
○ Note that the min.design ITS is as per T/19 Notes + 25kPa to ensure that the min.ITS values are obtained in the field
Detail of Activity / Test - Unconfined Compressive Strength, UCS
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 Optimisation test per aggregate type
Inspection / Test method - CCNZ / NPTG / CETANZ Industry Guide
Acceptance Criteria - UCS limits set by the design engineeer
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ Report
Detail of Activity / Test - Modified Maximum Dry Density
Minimum Test Frequency - At Optimised Binder selection
Acceptance Criteria - To determine target density
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ Report
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Required before Stabilisation comences

Inspection / Test method - Use grader's machine control and inspect shape

Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Intention is to carry out only minor correction (eg.2% to 3%). Any major shape corrections to be identified prior to site establishment and included in the site specific methodology statement
Detail of Activity / Test - Pre-hoe to depth specified and shape as instructed in the site spcific methodology statement and/or IFC drawings and proof roll while compacting
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to stabilisation per section
Inspection / Test method - Visual check or Vibratory Roller's response meter

Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Any soft spots identified by visual means or that show up as significantly different to be raised with the ER for further instructions
Detail of Activity / Test - Supply, pre-compact and trim to line and level with NZTA M/4 AP40
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to stabilisation per section
Acceptance Criteria - As per NZTA Z/16
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Check with Grader and visual inspection
Responsibility - Stabilising Contractor with Main Contractor
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - This is the last opportunity to check items before adding the FB. Assess items such as (but not limited to):
– any concerns with shape and tie in
Detail of Activity / Test - Plan showing cut lines and sequencing of works
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to each section
Acceptance Criteria - Points covered in NZTA B/5

3.04 - Spreading of powdered stabilising agent (Cement / Lime)
Detail of Activity / Test - Place 1m2 canvas or 0.5m x 0.5m trays along spreader run
Minimum Test Frequency - every 400 m2, every 150m for a 2.4m width
Inspection / Test method - Weigh mat or tray
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Daily work Log
3.05 - Spreading of powdered stabilising agent (Cement / Lime)
Detail of Activity / Test - Compare area spread with weight used for each spreader load
Minimum Test Frequency - On-going measurement by computer/load cells
Inspection / Test method - Measurement each run
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Daily work Log
3.06 - Injection of bituminous stabilising agent (FBS or BE)
Detail of Activity / Test - Flow meter and operator's display readings
Minimum Test Frequency - Continous monitoring by the operator and the grounds person
Inspection / Test method - Visual display reading
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - N/A
3.07 - Injection of bituminous stabilising agent (FBS or BE)
Detail of Activity / Test - Compare tonnes used (from the stabiiser's PCU) with the measured area
Minimum Test Frequency - Record usage from PCU at the end of each run
Inspection / Test method - Record readings at the end of each run
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Daily work Log
3.08 - Injection of bituminous stabilising agent (FBS or BE)
Detail of Activity / Test - Compare tonnes used (from delivery docket) with measured area
Minimum Test Frequency - For each bitumen tanker load
Inspection / Test method - Dip bitumen tanker before and after
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Daily work Log
Detail of Activity / Test - In-situ Stabilisation process
Minimum Test Frequency - On-going visual assessment
Inspection / Test method - Visual and hand squeeze test
Acceptance Criteria - Mixed material free of pockets or streaks. Overlaps minimum of 150mm
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Daily work Log
Detail of Activity / Test - Depth of stabilisation
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Daily work Log
Detail of Activity / Test - Stabilised material strength - ITS
Minimum Test Frequency - 3 soaked ITS + 3 dry ITS per Lot or when the material changes
– BSM Dry ITS: 150 kPa to 400 kPa
– BSM Soaked ITS: 120 kPa to 350 kPa
– BSM Dry ITS: 180 kPa to 450 kPa
– BSM Soaked ITS: 150 kPa to 420 kPa
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ Report
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - ITS briquettes to be produced on site if travel time to lab > 30 minutes.
Detail of Activity / Test - Plateau Density Test
Minimum Test Frequency - On first day per site and then 1 per 10,000m2 unless material or anvil conditions change
Inspection / Test method - Draft NZTA T/24 (Aug-2024)
Acceptance Criteria - To establish suitability of rollers and compaction mode / pattern to achieve FBS-MDD
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Field PDT sheet photos into ConQA for ER and Pavement designer to assess. IANZ report when processed.
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - If FBS-MDD can't be achieved then the PDT-MDD must be approved by the ER
Detail of Activity / Test - Maximum Dry Density
Minimum Test Frequency - On the first day on a new treatment section, then 1 per 10,000m2 unless the material changes
Acceptance Criteria - For analysis of DoC. To be done at the sampled MC, at hand squeze test MC and 1% above the hand squueze test on site.
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ Report

Project Specific Notes / Instructions - MDD briqutte to be produced on site if travel time to lab > 30 minutes. Note that if the Stabilising Contractor notices changes in material then another one point DD at the hand squeeze test moisture content shall be carried out.
Detail of Activity / Test - Degree of Compaction (DoC)
Inspection / Test method - NZS 4407.4.2.1 (DT full stabilising depth)
Acceptance Criteria - Average DoC ≥ 98%, Minimum DoC ≥ 95%
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ Report
Acceptance Criteria - ± 0.5% of specified crossfall measure, 2m apart
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Survey

Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Survey
Detail of Activity / Test - Surface Shape
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Survey
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Only required if the visual inspection appears unsatisfactory

Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Survey
Detail of Activity / Test - Surface Finish
Acceptance Criteria - 1. Larger aggregate held in pace with a matrix of smaller aggregate
2. Smaller aggregate held in place by fine material
3. matrix does not displace under normal trafficking and/or sweeping
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Survey
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - ER to be present at pre-seal inspection
Inspection / Test method - TNZ TM 7003 v1
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Test Certificate

Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Report only

Acceptance Criteria - Reporting of any non-conforming results to Designer via NCR
